summary: Shellfish aquaculture projects—the breeding, rearing, and harvesting of oysters, clams, and mussels—may require authorization from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. Among other things, the Corps examines compliance with navigation and environmental laws. We reviewed permit applications for such projects from 2012 through 2017 and found the Corps approved 87% of the 3,751 applications it received. It denied less than 1%. The rest were withdrawn...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Information on Shellfish Aquaculture Permitting Activities
